conclusion: Analyze forces on wire due to magnetic field and effect on spring scale readings
Uniform horizontal wire ab suspended below two identical spring scales in a magnetic field B perpendicular to the paper
Current I flows from a to b
Magnetic force on wire given by F = I * L * B
With current I, magnetic force F1 acts on wire upwards
Reading on one spring scale is F1
With reversed current 2I, force on wire becomes F = 2I * L * B downwards
Reading on one spring scale is F2
Equation for initial condition: F1 = W - I * L * B
Equation for reversed current condition: F2 = W + 2I * L * B
Subtract first equation from second: F2 - F1 = 3I * L * B
Solve for B: B = (F2 - F1) / (3I * L)
